dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3743 IH: Supporting Healthy Mothers and Infants Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Vindman (for himself, Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania, and Mr. Nunn of Iowa) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 to support women, infants, and children impacted by substance use disorder, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Supporting Healthy Mothers and Infants Act of 2025.

section.header: Amendments to special supplemental nutrition program

subsection.header: Special supplemental nutrition program for women, infants, and children
subsection.text: Section 17 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 (42 U.S.C. 1786) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking drug abuse and inserting substance use disorder;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (8), by striking drug abuse and inserting substance use disorder; and

clause.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking Drug abuse education and inserting Substance use disorder education;
in subparagraph (A), by striking dangers of drug abuse and inserting harm of substance use during pregnancy and lactation; and

subclause.text: by striking are suspected drug abusers and inserting may have a substance use disorder;
by striking drug abuse clinics,; and
by striking drug abuse professionals and inserting resources;

clause.text: by striking drug abuse each place it appears and inserting substance use disorder; and
by striking effects of drug and inserting effects of a substance use disorder; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (5), by striking substance abuse and inserting substance use disorder;
in paragraph (1)(C)(ix), by striking drugs and inserting illicit or other harmful substances; and
in paragraph (13), by striking drug abuse education and inserting substance use disorder education;
by striking 1 member and inserting one member; and
by striking drug abuse and inserting substance use disorder; and

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (l) through (q) as subsections (m) through (r), respectively, and by inserting after subsection (k) the following:

subsection.header: Activities To support WIC-Eligible individuals impacted by substance use disorder

subparagraph.text: develop and disseminate nutrition education materials for individuals eligible for the program; and
conduct outreach to individuals who are potentially eligible for the program and who are impacted by a substance use disorder.

paragraph.text: The purpose of this subsection is to ensure that individuals participating in the program who are impacted by a substance use disorder receive accurate nutrition education from trained staff in an effective and unbiased manner.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall collaborate with the Secretary of Health and Human Services to develop appropriate evidence-based nutrition education materials for individuals impacted by a substance use disorder, including—

clause.text: nutrition education materials for individuals with substance use disorder during pregnancy and in the postpartum period; and
nutrition education materials for infants impacted by prenatal substance exposure and neonatal abstinence syndrome.

subparagraph.text: The materials developed pursuant to subparagraph (A) shall be included in the educational materials developed under paragraph (15) of section 515(b) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 290bb–21(b)) and guidance issued under section 1005 of the SUPPORT for Patients and Communities Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a note).

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall make available to all State agencies through an online clearinghouse any nutrition education and training materials related to nutrition for individuals impacted by a substance use disorder or neonatal abstinence syndrome that have been produced by the Secretary or the Secretary of Health and Human Services (or produced by a State agency and approved by the Secretary), including educational materials developed under paragraph (15) of section 515(b) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 290bb–21(b)) and guidance issued under section 1005 of the SUPPORT for Patients and Communities Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a note).
There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this subsection $1,000,000 for fiscal year 2026, to remain available until expended.

subsection.text: Section 17(q) of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 (42 U.S.C. 1786(q)), as redesignated by subsection (a) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking subsection (o)(1)(A) and inserting subsection (p)(1)(A); and
in paragraph (2)(B), by striking subsection (o)(1)(A) and inserting subsection (p)(1)(A).
